skill.name: meeting-insights-analyzer
skill.description: Analyzes meeting transcripts and recordings to uncover behavioral patterns, communication insights, and actionable feedback. Identifies when you avoid conflict, use filler words, dominate conversations, or miss opportunities to listen. Perfect for professionals seeking to improve their communication and leadership skills.
skill.summary: Analyzes meeting transcripts and recordings to uncover behavioral patterns, communication insights, ...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. It provides instructions for analyzing meeting transcripts at the prompt level only. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access beyond natural AI capabilities, command execution, or environment variable access.

content.user_title: Analyze meeting transcripts for communication patterns
content.value_statement: Meeting transcripts contain hidden insights about your communication style that most people never discover. This skill scans your transcripts to identify conflict avoidance, filler words, speaking ratios, and listening habits so you can become a more effective communicator and leader.
actual_capabilities: Identifies conflict avoidance patterns and indirect communication in meetings
Calculates speaking ratios and tracks turn-taking behavior
Detects filler words and hedging language with frequency metrics
Recognizes active listening indicators and questioning patterns
Provides timestamped examples with specific improvement suggestions
Compares communication patterns across multiple meetings over time
limitations: Requires transcript files (.txt, .md, .vtt, .srt, .docx) to be provided
Does not record or transcribe meetings directly
Accuracy depends on transcript quality and speaker labeling
Cannot analyze video or audio without first converting to transcript

use_cases.title: Improve facilitation skills
use_cases.description: Analyze team meetings to understand speaking time distribution and how well you include quieter team members in discussions.

use_cases.title: Refine customer call patterns
use_cases.description: Review sales calls to identify questioning techniques that work and moments where you talked too much or missed buying signals.

use_cases.title: Prepare for performance reviews
use_cases.description: Track communication improvements over quarters with concrete examples of reduced filler words and better listening.

prompt_templates.title: Quick conflict scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze all meeting transcripts in this folder and identify every instance where I avoided a difficult conversation or gave indirect feedback instead of being direct.

prompt_templates.title: Communication overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Look at all my meetings from the past month and give me a complete communication analysis including my speaking ratio, filler word frequency, and listening score.

prompt_templates.title: Leadership assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my team meeting transcripts and tell me about my facilitation style. Include my speaking percentage, how I handle disagreements, and whether I draw in quieter participants.

prompt_templates.title: Progress tracking
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare my communication patterns between meetings from Q1 and Q2. Show me specific examples of where I improved and where I still need work.

output_examples.input: Analyze all my meetings and tell me when I avoided conflict.
output: Found 23 instances of conflict avoidance across 15 meetings
Pattern: Hedging on critical feedback (8 occurrences) - Example: 'Maybe we could potentially consider looking at the timeline again... whatever you think is best'
Pattern: Changing subject when tension arises (6 occurrences)
Recommendation: Name the issue directly in the first sentence and remove hedging words like 'maybe' and 'kind of'

best_practices: Use consistent file naming (YYYY-MM-DD - Meeting Name.txt) for easy time-based analysis
Review analysis monthly or quarterly to track meaningful progress over time
Focus on one behavior at a time for deeper insights rather than broad superficial analysis
anti_patterns: Analyzing meetings without speaker labels - results will be unreliable
Trying to change too many patterns at once - pick one area to improve
Ignoring positive patterns - the analysis includes strengths worth reinforcing

faq.question: What transcript formats are supported?
faq.answer: Supports .txt, .md, .vtt, .srt, and .docx files. Files must have speaker labels for accurate analysis.

faq.question: How many meetings can I analyze at once?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. The skill can process dozens of meetings, but very large batches may take longer.

faq.question: Does this work with video meeting platforms?
faq.answer: Yes, export transcripts from Zoom, Google Meet, Granola, Fireflies.ai, or Otter.ai in supported formats.

faq.question: Is my meeting data kept private?
faq.answer: Yes. All analysis happens locally. Transcripts never leave your machine unless you share them.

faq.question: What if my transcripts do not have timestamps?
faq.answer: The skill can still analyze content and patterns but cannot provide specific timestamps for examples.

faq.question: How is this different from basic sentiment analysis?
faq.answer: This goes beyond sentiment to identify specific behavioral patterns like interruptions, question types, and listening quality with actionable improvement suggestions.
